_comment: Placid carousel template structure for Content Empire. 7 slides is optimal for Instagram/LinkedIn algorithm.

slides.design_notes: Full-bleed background. Headline is the ONLY text. Large, bold, centered. Brand color background.
slides.visual_rule: Bold stat or question only. No body copy on slide 1.
slides.example_headline: 90% of professionals aren't ready for what's coming.

slides.design_notes: Split layout: icon or graphic left, text right. Subheading + 2-3 lines body.
slides.visual_rule: Introduce the tension. Why does this matter now?

slides.design_notes: Large number (01) in brand color. Clean, minimal. Data or bold claim.
slides.visual_rule: One insight only. If it needs more than 2 lines to explain, cut it.

slides.design_notes: Same layout as slide 3, alternating accent color.
slides.visual_rule: Builds on insight 1. Raises the stakes.

slides.design_notes: Same layout. Third insight should be the most surprising or actionable.
slides.visual_rule: The 'turn' — this is what makes people save the carousel.

slides.design_notes: Warm, personal tone. Quote-style layout or checklist. This slide gets saved.
slides.visual_rule: Practical. Gives them something to DO or REMEMBER.

slides.design_notes: Brand colors, handle visible. One CTA. Save / Follow / Comment.
slides.visual_rule: Never two CTAs on the last slide. Pick one and commit.
slides.example_cta: Save this. You'll need it. | Follow {{HANDLE}} for weekly insights.

caption_template.save_prompt: Save this before you scroll past it.
caption_template.hashtag_comment: // Put hashtags in first comment for cleaner look

algorithm_checklist: Hook slide stops the scroll — no one should swipe past slide 1
Swipe-to-next hook visible on each slide edge (15px of next slide showing)
7 slides is optimal — do not cut to 5 unless topic doesn't support 7
Slide 5 or 6 delivers the highest-value insight (save-worthy moment)
Last slide has handle visible for new-account discovery
Caption hook works WITHOUT seeing the slides (for feed preview)
All text readable at mobile size — minimum 28pt equivalent
